nfqnl_test.c

2 #include <stdio.h>
3 #include <stdlib.h>
4 #include <unistd.h>
5 #include <netinet/in.h>
6 #include <linux/types.h>
7 #include <linux/netfilter.h> /* for NF_ACCEPT */
8 #include <errno.h>
9 
10 #include <libnetfilter_queue/libnetfilter_queue.h>
11 
12 /* returns packet id */
13 static uint32_t print_pkt (struct nfq_data *tb)
14 {
15  int id = 0;
16  struct nfqnl_msg_packet_hdr *ph;
17  struct nfqnl_msg_packet_hw *hwph;
18  uint32_t mark, ifi, uid, gid;
19  int ret;
20  unsigned char *data, *secdata;
21  char pktbuf[1024*10];
22  int flags = 0;
23  int retxml;
24  uint32_t skbinfo;
25  //uint32_t orig_len = 0;
26 
27  flags = flags | NFQ_XML_ALL;
28  if ((retxml=nfq_snprintf_xml(pktbuf, 1024*10, tb, flags)) > 0 ) {
29  printf("pktbuf(%s)\n",pktbuf);
30  }
31 
32  skbinfo = nfq_get_skbinfo(tb);
33  if (skbinfo & NFQA_SKB_GSO)
34  printf("GSO ");
35 
36  /*
37  * ip/tcp checksums are not yet valid, e.g. due to GRO/GSO.
38  * The application should behave as if the checksums are correct.
39  *
40  * If these packets are later forwarded/sent out, the checksums will
41  * be corrected by kernel/hardware.
42  */
43  if (skbinfo & NFQA_SKB_CSUMNOTREADY)
44  printf(" checksum not ready");
45  if (skbinfo & NFQA_SKB_CSUM_NOTVERIFIED)
46  printf(" checksum not verified");
47 
48  ph = nfq_get_msg_packet_hdr(tb);
49  if (ph) {
50  id = ntohl(ph->packet_id);
51  printf("hw_protocol=0x%04x hook=%u id=%u ",
52  ntohs(ph->hw_protocol), ph->hook, id);
53  }
54 
55  hwph = nfq_get_packet_hw(tb);
56  if (hwph) {
57  int i, hlen = ntohs(hwph->hw_addrlen);
58 
59  printf("hw_src_addr=");
60  for (i = 0; i < hlen-1; i++)
61  printf("%02x:", hwph->hw_addr[i]);
62  printf("%02x ", hwph->hw_addr[hlen-1]);
63  }
64 
65  mark = nfq_get_nfmark(tb);
66  if (mark)
67  printf("mark=%u ", mark);
68 
69  ifi = nfq_get_indev(tb);
70  if (ifi)
71  printf("indev=%u ", ifi);
72 
73  ifi = nfq_get_outdev(tb);
74  if (ifi)
75  printf("outdev=%u ", ifi);
76  ifi = nfq_get_physindev(tb);
77  if (ifi)
78  printf("physindev=%u ", ifi);
79 
80  ifi = nfq_get_physoutdev(tb);
81  if (ifi)
82  printf("physoutdev=%u ", ifi);
83 
84  if (nfq_get_uid(tb, &uid))
85  printf("uid=%u ", uid);
86 
87  if (nfq_get_gid(tb, &gid))
88  printf("gid=%u ", gid);
89 
90  ret = nfq_get_secctx(tb, &secdata);
91  if (ret > 0)
92  printf("secctx=\"%.*s\" ", ret, secdata);
93 
94  ret = nfq_get_payload(tb, &data);
95  if (ret >= 0)
96  printf("payload_len=%d ", ret);
97 
98  //orig_len = nfq_get_caplen(tb);
99  //printf("orig_len(%d), payload_len(%d)", orig_len, ret);
100 
101  fputc('\n', stdout);
102 
103  return id;
104 }
105 
106 
107 static int cb(struct nfq_q_handle *qh, struct nfgenmsg *nfmsg,
108  struct nfq_data *nfa, void *data)
109 {
110  uint32_t id = print_pkt(nfa);
111  printf("entering callback\n");
112  return nfq_set_verdict(qh, id, NF_ACCEPT, 0, NULL);
113 }
114 
115 int main(int argc, char **argv)
116 {
117  struct nfq_handle *h;
118  struct nfq_q_handle *qh;
119  int fd;
120  int rv;
121  uint32_t queue = 0;
122  char buf[4096] __attribute__ ((aligned));
123 
124  if (argc == 2) {
125  queue = atoi(argv[1]);
126  if (queue > 65535) {
127  fprintf(stderr, "Usage: %s [<0-65535>]\n", argv[0]);
128  exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
129  }
130  }
131 
132  printf("opening library handle\n");
133  h = nfq_open();
134  if (!h) {
135  fprintf(stderr, "error during nfq_open()\n");
136  exit(1);
137  }
138 
139  printf("unbinding existing nf_queue handler for AF_INET (if any)\n");
140  if (nfq_unbind_pf(h, AF_INET) < 0) {
141  fprintf(stderr, "error during nfq_unbind_pf()\n");
142  exit(1);
143  }
144 
145  printf("binding nfnetlink_queue as nf_queue handler for AF_INET\n");
146  if (nfq_bind_pf(h, AF_INET) < 0) {
147  fprintf(stderr, "error during nfq_bind_pf()\n");
148  exit(1);
149  }
150 
151  printf("binding this socket to queue '%d'\n", queue);
152  qh = nfq_create_queue(h, queue, &cb, NULL);
153  if (!qh) {
154  fprintf(stderr, "error during nfq_create_queue()\n");
155  exit(1);
156  }
157 
158  printf("setting copy_packet mode\n");
159  if (nfq_set_mode(qh, NFQNL_COPY_PACKET, 0xffff) < 0) {
160  fprintf(stderr, "can't set packet_copy mode\n");
161  exit(1);
162  }
163 
164  printf("setting flags to fail open\n");
165  if (nfq_set_queue_flags(qh, NFQA_CFG_F_FAIL_OPEN, NFQA_CFG_F_FAIL_OPEN)) {
166  fprintf(stderr, "This kernel version does not allow to "
167  "set fail oepn.\n");
168  }
169 
170  printf("setting flags to gso\n");
171  if (nfq_set_queue_flags(qh, NFQA_CFG_F_GSO, NFQA_CFG_F_GSO)) {
172  fprintf(stderr, "This kernel version does not allow to "
173  "set gso.\n");
174  }
175 
176  printf("setting flags to request UID and GID\n");
177  if (nfq_set_queue_flags(qh, NFQA_CFG_F_UID_GID, NFQA_CFG_F_UID_GID)) {
178  fprintf(stderr, "This kernel version does not allow to "
179  "retrieve process UID/GID.\n");
180  }
181 
182  printf("setting flags to request security context\n");
183  if (nfq_set_queue_flags(qh, NFQA_CFG_F_SECCTX, NFQA_CFG_F_SECCTX)) {
184  fprintf(stderr, "This kernel version does not allow to "
185  "retrieve security context.\n");
186  }
187 
188  printf("Waiting for packets...\n");
189 
190  fd = nfq_fd(h);
191 
192  for (;;) {
193  if ((rv = recv(fd, buf, sizeof(buf), 0)) >= 0) {
194  printf("pkt received\n");
195  nfq_handle_packet(h, buf, rv);
196  continue;
197  }
198  /* if your application is too slow to digest the packets that
199  * are sent from kernel-space, the socket buffer that we use
200  * to enqueue packets may fill up returning ENOBUFS. Depending
201  * on your application, this error may be ignored. Please, see
202  * the doxygen documentation of this library on how to improve
203  * this situation.
204  */
205  if (rv < 0 && errno == ENOBUFS) {
206  printf("losing packets!\n");
207  continue;
208  }
209  perror("recv failed");
210  break;
211  }
212 
213  printf("unbinding from queue 0\n");
214  nfq_destroy_queue(qh);
215 
216 #ifdef INSANE
217  /* normally, applications SHOULD NOT issue this command, since
218  * it detaches other programs/sockets from AF_INET, too ! */
219  printf("unbinding from AF_INET\n");
220  nfq_unbind_pf(h, AF_INET);
221 #endif
222 
223  printf("closing library handle\n");
224  nfq_close(h);
225 
226  exit(0);
227 }

Definition: libnetfilter_queue.c:719

Definition: libnetfilter_queue.c:1056

Definition: libnetfilter_queue.c:1236
nfq_set_verdict
int nfq_set_verdict(struct nfq_q_handle *qh, uint32_t id, uint32_t verdict, uint32_t data_len, const unsigned char *buf)
